text: Signalling via <extra_id_0> CD28 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> of human naive neonatal T lymphocytes .
Accessory molecules play a crucial role in the development of the T cell response to antigenic challenge .
We have examined the role of <extra_id_0> CD28 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in modulating the 'naive ' neonatal T cell response to anti-CD2 - mediated activation .

To compare the role of <extra_id_0> CD28 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , neonatal and adult T cells were stimulated with a pair of mitogenic anti-CD2 antibodies in the presence or absence of anti - <extra_id_0> CD28 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> MoAb .

With anti-CD2 alone , neonatal T cells proliferated slightly but produced no detectable <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , whereas adult T cells proliferated vigorously , with significant <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> production .

text: Costimulation with anti - <extra_id_0> CD28 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> MoAb greatly enhanced the proliferative response of neonatal T cells to levels equivalent to those of adult T cells , whereas adult T cells showed only slight increases .

Although <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> secretion was increased in the presence of anti - <extra_id_0> CD28 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> MoAb , neonatal T cell <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> production remained lower than in adults .

text: Anti - <extra_id_0> CD28 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> MoAb costimulation increased NF kappa B levels in neonates , albeit to levels lower than that of adults .

The cellular mechanism governing the diminished proliferative response of neonatal T lymphocytes to anti-CD2 may therefore be due to decreased NF kappa B induction , reduced <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA expression and deficient <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> production .
